item.title: FBI: North Korean IT workers steal source code to extort employers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI warned today that North Korean IT workers are abusing their access to steal source code and extort U.S. companies that have been tricked into hiring them. [...]

item.title: Google launches customizable Web Store for Enterprise extensions
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google has officially launched its Chrome Web Store for Enterprises, allowing organizations to create a curated list of extensions that can be installed in employees' web browsers. [...]

item.title: Hundreds of fake Reddit sites push Lumma Stealer malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are distributing close to 1,000 web pages mimicking Reddit and the WeTransfer file sharing service that lead to downloading the Lumma Stealer malware. [...]

item.title: QNAP fixes six Rsync vulnerabilities in NAS backup, recovery app
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: QNAP has fixed six rsync vulnerabilities that could let attackers gain remote code execution on unpatched Network Attached Storage (NAS) devices. [...]

item.title: New Android Identity Check locks settings outside trusted locations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google has announced a new Android "Identity Check" security feature that lock sensitive settings behind biometric authentication when outside a trusted location. [...]

item.title: Brave Search now lets users ‘Rerank’ results from favorite sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Brave Search has introduced a new feature called Rerank, which allows users to define search results ordering preferences and set specific sites rank higher. [...]

item.title: CISA: Hackers still exploiting older Ivanti bugs to breach networks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA and the FBI warned today that attackers are still exploiting Ivanti Cloud Service Appliances (CSA) security flaws patched since September to breach vulnerable networks. [...]

item.title: SonicWall warns of SMA1000 RCE flaw exploited in zero-day attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SonicWall is warning about a pre-authentication deserialization vulnerability in SonicWall SMA1000 Appliance Management Console (AMC) and Central Management Console (CMC), with reports that it has been exploited as a zero-day in attacks. [...]

item.title: Stealthy 'Magic Packet' malware targets Juniper VPN gateways
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A malicious campaign has been specifically targeting Juniper edge devices, many acting as VPN gateways, with malware dubbed J-magic that starts a reverse shell only if it detects a "magic packet" in the network traffic. [...]

item.title: Tesla EV charger hacked twice on second day of Pwn2Own Tokyo
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Security researchers hacked Tesla's Wall Connector electric vehicle charger twice on the second day of the Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 hacking contest. [...]

item.title: Critical zero-days impact premium WordPress real estate plugins
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The RealHome theme and the Easy Real Estate plugins for WordPress are vulnerable to two critical severity flaws that allow unauthenticated users to gain administrative privileges. [...]

item.title: Cloudflare CDN flaw leaks user location data, even through secure chat apps
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A security researcher discovered a flaw in Cloudflare's content delivery network (CDN), which could expose a person's general location by simply sending them an image on platforms like Signal and Discord. [...]

item.title: Telegram captcha tricks you into running malicious PowerShell scripts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors on X are exploiting the news around Ross Ulbricht to direct unsuspecting users to a Telegram channel that tricks them into executing PowerShell code that infects them with malware. [...]
